Title: Units of p-adic integers
Content:
How to prove that the $p$-adic units can be written as
$$\mathbb{Z}_p^\times \cong \mu_{p-1}\times(1 + p\mathbb{Z}_p) \cong \mathbb{Z}/(p-1)\mathbb{Z}\times\mathbb{Z}_p$$
where $\mu_n$ is the $n$-th roots of unity in $\mathbb{Z}_p$? Here $p>2$ is a prime number. Any hint or link would be helpful. Besides, it looks strange: why the units of $\mathbb{Z}_p$ is isomorphic to some guy which looks bigger than $\mathbb{Z}_p$?
